page.title: 05EDUCATION HAMSTERLEY FOREST
page.content: The Forestry Commission,together with the L.E.A. have developed part of the forest for educational use.There is an Information Centre and limited accomodation for use by youth,school and other study groups. Schools make frequent day visits and generally use an area close to the Forestry Commission office from where a wide range of habitats can be examined.The main aims are to encourage children to learn about forestry as an important industry and to use the man-made environment to learn about ecology.A helpful teachers guide is available.Children from all over the North East of England visit the forest for a general insight or to make specific studies,such as stream or fungi.The potential for educational use is wide in such a stimulating environment.
